page.title: 05BRANCEPETH
page.content: In contrast to the large estates in Brandon, Brancepeth is a small village which has a castle,church, old village cottages,and,since 1975, some very exclusively designed houses on 3 small private developments, making a total of 68 houses, all private, in the village.The station has also closed.Oh yes,at the crossroads there is a very famous "conker"(horse chestnut) tree which is raided every year by small boys for the very special "conkers". Few villagers have lived here all their lives. They thought Brancepeth was important because of the castle and the golf course. There was once a cricket field near the station but the owners did not renew the lease hoping to sell the land for building houses on.Villagers protested but to no avail.
